现的“文化多元主义”（Cultural Pluralism）思想和黑人民族主义（Black Nationalism）思潮更是对多元文化主义的兴起有重要联系。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French pluralite, from late Latin pluralitas, from Latin pluralis 'relating to more than one' (see plural)

entry.def: If there is a plurality of things, a number of them exist.

example.ex: Federalism implies a plurality of political authorities, each with its own powers.
example.tran: 联邦制意味着存在众多各自都拥有权力的政治管理机构。

entry.def: If a candidate, political party, or idea has the support of a plurality of people, they have more support than any other candidate, party, or idea.

example.ex: The Conservative party retained a plurality of the votes...
example.tran: 保守党保住了选票的多数优势。

example.ex: 35% of the population, a plurality, believed that the economic reforms would result in only insignificant change.
example.tran: 有35%的多数民众认为，经济改革不会带来实质性的变革。

entry.tran: （指选举中获胜者得到的不及其他所有候选人得票总和的）相对多数（票）
entry.def: A plurality in an election is the number of votes that the winner gets, when this is less than the total number of votes for all the other candidates.

example.ex: He only got a plurality on November 3rd, just 49 percent.
example.tran: 他在11月3号的选举中仅获得了49%的相对多数票。

entry.tran: （指选举中获得最多票数的候选人与得票数第二的候选人之间的）票数差额
entry.def: A plurality in an election is the difference in the number of votes between the candidate who gets the most votes and the candidate who comes second.

example.ex: Franklin had won with a plurality in electoral votes of 449 to 82.
example.tran: 富兰克林在选举团投票中以449票比82票的差额胜出。

sentences.sentence: "to mark plurality, one language may add an extra syllable to the word whereas another may simply change the vowel in the existing final syllable"

means.word_mean: 3. (in an election with more than 2 options) the number of votes for the candidate or party receiving the greatest number (but less that half of the votes)
